node.title: Intro to UI/UX
node.description: Learn about how to design great user interfaces and user experience.
node.author: Kevin Cook

node.title: API 101
node.description: Learn how to use APIs for your project from scratch.
node.author: Nicolas Grenié

node.title: How to pitch your project
node.description: Wondering what's the best way to pitch your project and make sure people understand its value as it is? Join to learn more on product pitching, elevator pitch and more.
node.author: Kyle Judah

node.title: Query APIs and Databases with a single querying language
node.description: In this workshop we'll be using an open source querying language to learn how to querying multiple data sources such as databases and APIs. Data sources can be joined together [through merges or chained requests] into one simple query to combine and enrich data. As a maintainer of this open source technology, I'll also be diving into what it's like to work on open source and tips on making your first pull request.
node.author: Alex Walling

node.title: How to find a Tech Job/Internship
node.description: Looking for an internship in a big tech company? Listen to Alex experience as a Facebook intern and now a full-time Microsoft manager.
node.author: Alex Lacey

node.title: Building with the Decentralised Web
node.description: Learn to build decentralised apps using IPFS and the Ethereum blockchain
node.author: Scott Street

node.title: Intro to git/GitHub
node.description: Learn more about git and how to use it to make your project successful.
node.author: Abdulhakim Ajetunmobi

node.title: Neutral Vehicle: Simulated Car Hacking
node.description: Hack this simulated vehicle to win the challenge.
node.author: Cyber Security Club and CU TCP

node.title: !Light
node.description: Sharpen your frontend development skills with this activity, where you’ll be recreating a website in HTML/CSS using our code editor - all without previewing your code along the way.

node.title: Slideshare karaoke
node.description: Practice public speaking skills with a fun activity. Presenters are given a random slide deck and must deliver an improvised speech to their audience!

node.title: Women in Tech Panel/ Fireside Chat
node.description: Join us for this panel with leaders of the sector talking about the future of technology

node.title: Amateur radio station KØH
node.description: KØH is a special event amateur radio station commemorating the HackCU V hackathon. KØH is intended to introduce HackCU participants and visitors to the world of amateur radio.

node.title: The Joy of MS Painting
node.description: Unleash your inner artist in this chill activity where we will be using the amazing, incredible, ultra-accurate Microsoft Paint to create a great artwork. Winners will have their artwork featured in a connor.fun t-shirt.

node.title: Hackathon Organizers Meetup
node.description: Join us to discuss and talk about the future of hackathons in the US and to help with tips to organize better hackathons.

node.title: Face masks
node.description: Relax a bit and catch your breath with this amazing face masks. Perfect for energizing before the night.
